treatment.description: Bulb ellipsoid, 26–56 × 17–31 mm, sometimes with blackish, fibrous tunic. Leaves (28–)35–41(–53) cm × 7–14 mm, mature plants with blackish, shriveled foliage persisting at base of scape; blade glaucous-green, aging to light green. Scape 40–89 cm, often with 1–3 ascending branches, 3–5 mm thick at base. Inflorescences: terminal raceme (5–)14–27(–40) cm; flowers (24–)44–51(–78) per 10 cm of raceme. Seeds dark gray-green to black, 4–6 mm. 2n = 52.
treatment.habitat: open rocky seepage areas with year-round water supply, bogs
treatment.discussion: At high elevations, Hastingsia alba is often stunted and has smaller bulbs, shorter scapes with shorter and narrower leaves, and spreading-rotate tepal tips.
